title: 5 Affordable Trends That Scream 2025
text: This year is officially delivering trends that strike the perfect balance between bold, wearable, and current, proving they can be budget-friendly too. Whether you're looking to add a fresh new hue to your wardrobe or test out a statement style to sprinkle into your outfit rotation, we're sharing five ways to update your closet with options under $200.The key here is to focus on multifunctional pieces that can move seamlessly between seasons and occasions, like pairing pretty pink items with staples you already own and adding the right accessories to finish off your outfit. These trends are equal parts wearable and stylish, making them the perfect additions to your 2025 wardrobe lineup. Below, we're breaking down the must-haves for your fashion refresh, all while staying at an affordable price point. Shop the five trends that will dominate this year without draining your wallet.1. Martini Olive GreenThis rich, sophisticated green is the neutral you didn't know you needed. It pairs effortlessly with black, white, and denim for that polished "I just threw this on" energy. Bonus: It works for any season. Pro tip? Look for a layering piece like a simple crewneck sweater or cardigan in this hue to elevate your transitional dressing.Shop our under-$200 picks: Reformation Nadia Knit Dress ZARA Crop Corduroy Jacket Sam Edelman Ollie Square Toe Bit Mules 2. Soft PowerPower dressing just got a glow-up. Think clean, minimalistic tailoring in softer silhouettes and tones that still exude authority. Wide-leg trousers, relaxed-fit blazers, and collared shirts in airy fabrics are key here. Keep an eye out for affordable sets that can be mixed, matched, and styled up or down.Shop our under-$200 picks: MANGO Wool Mini-Skirt With Belt COS Tide Corduroy Wide-Leg Jeans Nordstrom Cashmere V-Neck Sweater 3. Racing SneakersInspired by motorsport aesthetics, this trend brings sleek lines, bold color-blocking, and performance vibes to the streets. Pair racing sneakers with tailored trousers and midi skirts for that high-low mix that screams effortless cool. Brands like Puma and Adidas are, of course, go-tos when it comes to this footwear trend.Shop our under-$200 picks: Jeffrey Campbell Aleta Sneaker Adidas Taekwondo Quilted Leather Sneakers PUMA Speedcat OG Sneakers COS Minimal Suede Trainers 4. Pretty PinksFrom muted blush to milky rose, pink is stealing the show this year. While the Barbiecore frenzy is officially out, 2025's pink feels grown-up and versatile. Try a pop of pink with a statement top, or add subtle details through accessories, like a bag or shoes. The key? Balance the sweetness with something edgy—think dark denim and oversize outerwear.Shop our under-$200 picks: Reformation Balia Linen Top Standards & Practices Cowl Neck Satin Slipdress Free-Est Perfect Tones Set ZARA Satin Effect Tied Halter Top 5. SuedeTextural, timeless, and surprisingly versatile, suede is making a comeback across footwear, outerwear, and even bags. Go for earthy tones—tan, chocolate, and cognac—for a classic vibe that still feels 2025 ready. Affordable suede-effect pieces (faux options, we're looking at you) make it easy to embrace this luxe look without splurging. Boots, a belt, or a bag in suede will instantly elevate any outfit.Shop our under-$200 picks: MANGO Suede-Effect Jacket With Fleece Collar B-Low the Belt Milla Suede Belt Steve Madden Dollie Boots Madewell Puffy Buckle Shoulder Suede Bag BLANKNYC Suede Maxi Skirt
html:
This year is officially delivering trends that strike the perfect balance between bold, wearable, and current, proving they can be budget-friendly too. Whether you're looking to add a fresh new hue to your wardrobe or test out a statement style to sprinkle into your outfit rotation, we're sharing five ways to update your closet with options under $200.

The key here is to focus on multifunctional pieces that can move seamlessly between seasons and occasions, like pairing pretty pink items with staples you already own and adding the right accessories to finish off your outfit. These trends are equal parts wearable and stylish, making them the perfect additions to your 2025 wardrobe lineup. Below, we're breaking down the must-haves for your fashion refresh, all while staying at an affordable price point. Shop the five trends that will dominate this year without draining your wallet.

1. Martini Olive Green

This rich, sophisticated green is the neutral you didn't know you needed. It pairs effortlessly with black, white, and denim for that polished "I just threw this on" energy. Bonus: It works for any season. Pro tip? Look for a layering piece like a simple crewneck sweater or cardigan in this hue to elevate your transitional dressing.

Shop our under-$200 picks:

Reformation

Nadia Knit Dress

ZARA

Crop Corduroy Jacket

Sam Edelman

Ollie Square Toe Bit Mules

2. Soft Power

Power dressing just got a glow-up. Think clean, minimalistic tailoring in softer silhouettes and tones that still exude authority. Wide-leg trousers, relaxed-fit blazers, and collared shirts in airy fabrics are key here. Keep an eye out for affordable sets that can be mixed, matched, and styled up or down.

Shop our under-$200 picks:

MANGO

Wool Mini-Skirt With Belt

COS

Tide Corduroy Wide-Leg Jeans

Nordstrom

Cashmere V-Neck Sweater

3. Racing Sneakers

Inspired by motorsport aesthetics, this trend brings sleek lines, bold color-blocking, and performance vibes to the streets. Pair racing sneakers with tailored trousers and midi skirts for that high-low mix that screams effortless cool. Brands like Puma and Adidas are, of course, go-tos when it comes to this footwear trend.

Shop our under-$200 picks:

Jeffrey Campbell

Aleta Sneaker

Adidas

Taekwondo Quilted Leather Sneakers

PUMA

Speedcat OG Sneakers

COS

Minimal Suede Trainers

4. Pretty Pinks

From muted blush to milky rose, pink is stealing the show this year. While the Barbiecore frenzy is officially out, 2025's pink feels grown-up and versatile. Try a pop of pink with a statement top, or add subtle details through accessories, like a bag or shoes. The key? Balance the sweetness with something edgy—think dark denim and oversize outerwear.

Shop our under-$200 picks:

Reformation

Balia Linen Top

Standards & Practices

Cowl Neck Satin Slipdress

Free-Est

Perfect Tones Set

ZARA

Satin Effect Tied Halter Top

5. Suede

Textural, timeless, and surprisingly versatile, suede is making a comeback across footwear, outerwear, and even bags. Go for earthy tones—tan, chocolate, and cognac—for a classic vibe that still feels 2025 ready. Affordable suede-effect pieces (faux options, we're looking at you) make it easy to embrace this luxe look without splurging. Boots, a belt, or a bag in suede will instantly elevate any outfit.

Shop our under-$200 picks:

MANGO

Suede-Effect Jacket With Fleece Collar

B-Low the Belt

Milla Suede Belt

Steve Madden

Dollie Boots

Madewell

Puffy Buckle Shoulder Suede Bag

BLANKNYC

Suede Maxi Skirt
